  • Method Details

    • refresh

      public void refresh()
      Refresh the plugin manager contents, reloading all installed plugins. This will clear the current plugin list and rediscover all plugins in the manifest directory.

    • plugins

      public Set<PluginID> plugins()
      Get the installed plugins.
      Returns:
      The plugin map

    • getPluginManifest

      public Optional<PluginManifest> getPluginManifest(PluginID pluginID)
      Get the plugin manifest with the given ID.
      Parameters:
      pluginID - The ID of the plugin to retrieve
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the Plugin manifest if found, or empty if not found

    • moduleLayers

      public Stream<ModuleLayer> moduleLayers()
      Specified by:
      moduleLayers in interface ModuleLayerProvider

    • installPluginFromBundle

      public void installPluginFromBundle(Path bundleFile)
      Install a plugin bundle from a file. The bundle file must contain a valid plugin manifest. If the plugin is already installed, it will be updated if the new version is greater than the existing one.
      Parameters:
      bundleFile - The path to the plugin bundle file

    • installPluginFromJar

      public void installPluginFromJar(Path jarFile)
      Install a plugin from a JAR file. The JAR file must contain a valid plugin manifest. If the plugin is already installed, it will be updated if the new version is greater than the existing one. It also retrieves the plugin dependencies and copies them to the artifacts directory.
      Parameters:
      jarFile - The path to the plugin JAR file

    • removePlugin

      public void removePlugin(PluginID pluginID)
      Remove a plugin from the manager. The plugin must be installed.
      Parameters:
      pluginID - The ID of the plugin to remove

    • setArtifactStore

      public void setArtifactStore(ArtifactStore artifactStore)
      Set the artifact store for this plugin manager. The artifact store is used to retrieve artifacts for plugins.
      Parameters:
      artifactStore - The artifact store to set

    • artifactStore

      public ArtifactStore artifactStore()
      Get the artifact store for this plugin manager. The artifact store is used to retrieve artifacts for plugins.
      Returns:
      The artifact store

    • application

      public String application()
      Get the application name for which this plugin manager is configured.
      Returns:
      The application name

    • addValidator

      public PluginManager addValidator(PluginValidator validator)
      Adds a custom validator to be executed before plugin installation.

      Validators are executed in the order they are added. If any validator returns an invalid result, the plugin installation is rejected with a PluginValidationException.

      Parameters:
      validator - the validator to add
      Returns:
      this PluginManager for method chaining
      See Also:
      • PluginValidator

    • validators

      public List<PluginValidator> validators()
      Returns an unmodifiable view of the registered validators.
      Returns:
      list of registered validators

    • addListener

      public PluginManager addListener(PluginListener listener)
      Adds a listener to receive plugin lifecycle events.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to add
      Returns:
      this PluginManager for method chaining
      See Also:
      • PluginListener
      • PluginEvent

    • removeListener

      public boolean removeListener(PluginListener listener)
      Removes a previously added listener.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to remove
      Returns:
      true if the listener was removed, false if it was not found

    • reloadPlugin

      public void reloadPlugin(PluginID pluginID)
      Reloads a plugin by re-reading its manifest and rebuilding its module layer.

      This method allows updating a plugin without restarting the application. The plugin's manifest is read again from disk, and the module layer is rebuilt.

      Important: Existing instances created from the old plugin classes will not be updated. Callers should clear any caches (such as ExtensionManager.clear()) after reloading to ensure new instances are created from the updated plugin.

      Registered PluginListeners will receive:

      1. An PluginEvent.Type.UNLOADED event before unloading
      2. A PluginEvent.Type.RELOADED event after successful reload
      Parameters:
      pluginID - the ID of the plugin to reload
      Throws:
      PluginException - if the plugin is not installed or cannot be reloaded
      See Also:
      • PluginListener

    • reloadAllPlugins

      public void reloadAllPlugins()
      Reloads all installed plugins.

      This is equivalent to calling reloadPlugin(PluginID) for each installed plugin, but more efficient as it rebuilds the module layer tree only once at the end.

      See Also:
      • reloadPlugin(PluginID)
